Key Arguments: The bill suppresses free speech by restricting information, which is essential for a healthy democracy.
Fringe views rarely gain momentum, and people should be exposed to all discussions to form their own opinions.
Governments should not have the power to decide what is true, as they have lied in the past.
The bill allows ACMA to impose penalties on social media platforms for perceived misinformation, which could lead to unjust censorship.
Notable Quotes: Suppressing information of any kind is suppressing free speech.
A healthy democracy needs freedom of speech where ideas can be discussed and debated.
Governments have lied in the past (Tampa, Weapons of Mass destruction).
